definition[0]: a situation in which there is total freedom and anything can happen â€“ used to show disapproval
example[0]: the free-for-all of sexual activity in the 1970s
definition[1]: a noisy quarrel or fight involving a lot of people
example[1]: A controversial penalty decision sparked a free-for-all at the end of the match.
definition[2]: a disorganized situation in which there are no rules or controls and many people or companies are competing together
example[2]: Many airlines were financially crippled by the free-for-all in the deregulated American market.
